alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 03 at 12:09PM MDT until November 04 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM FRIDAY TO 11 AM PDT SATURDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winter Storm Warning above 5000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches, with up to 2 feet for elevations above 6,000 feet. Frequent wind gusts of 40 to 60 mph will develop Friday night and will continue through Saturday morning. * WHERE...Elk River, Highway 11 Pierce to Headquarters, Pierce, Dixie, Elk City, and Highway 12 Lowell to Lolo Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 11 AM PDT Friday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 11 AM Friday to 11 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan for slippery road conditions Friday morning. Friday afternoon through Saturday morning, backcountry travel will be very difficult to impossible. Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Heavy snow and blowing snow will drift over remote trails and backcountry roadways.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains
